segment.source: Debugging, testing, and performance
segment.target: Debugging, testing, and performance

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Use Microsoft Visual Studio to debug and test your app.
segment.target: Use Microsoft Visual Studio to debug and test your app.

segment.source: To prepare your app for the Windows Store certification process, use the Windows App Certification Kit.
segment.target: To prepare your app for the Windows Store certification process, use the Windows App Certification Kit.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Deploying and debugging UWP apps
segment.target: Deploying and debugging UWP apps

segment.source: This article guides you through the steps to target various deployment and debugging targets.
segment.target: This article guides you through the steps to target various deployment and debugging targets.

segment.source: Test with the Microsoft Emulator for Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Test with the Microsoft Emulator for Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Simulate real-world interaction with a device and test the features of your app by using the tools included with Microsoft Emulator for Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: Simulate real-world interaction with a device and test the features of your app by using the tools included with Microsoft Emulator for Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: The emulator is a desktop application that emulates a mobile device running Windows 10.
segment.target: The emulator is a desktop application that emulates a mobile device running Windows 10.

segment.source: It provides a virtualized environment in which you can debug and test Windows apps without a physical device.
segment.target: It provides a virtualized environment in which you can debug and test Windows apps without a physical device.

segment.source: It also provides an isolated environment for your application prototypes.
segment.target: It also provides an isolated environment for your application prototypes.

segment.source: Beta testing
segment.target: Beta testing

segment.source: Beta testing gives you the chance to improve your app based on feedback from individuals outside of your app-development team who try your unreleased app on their own devices.
segment.target: Beta testing gives you the chance to improve your app based on feedback from individuals outside of your app-development team who try your unreleased app on their own devices.

segment.source: Windows App Certification Kit
segment.target: Windows App Certification Kit

segment.source: To give your app the best chance of being Windows App Certification Kit.
segment.target: To give your app the best chance of being Windows App Certification Kit.

segment.source: Performance
segment.target: Performance

segment.source: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.
segment.target: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.

segment.source: Technically, performance is a non-functional requirement but treating performance as a feature will help you deliver on your users' expectations.
segment.target: Technically, performance is a non-functional requirement but treating performance as a feature will help you deliver on your users' expectations.

segment.source: Specifying goals, and measuring, are key factors.
segment.target: Specifying goals, and measuring, are key factors.

segment.source: Determine what your performance-critical scenarios are; define what good performance mean.
segment.target: Determine what your performance-critical scenarios are; define what good performance mean.

segment.source: Then measure early and often enough throughout the lifecycle of your project to be confident you'll hit your goals.
segment.target: Then measure early and often enough throughout the lifecycle of your project to be confident you'll hit your goals.
